other_tests.findings: The JNCL donor was heterozygous for a approximately 1 kb deletion in CLN3, gross pathology of the retina resembled retinitis pigmentosa, including deposits of bone spicule pigment, loss of neurons from all retinal layers, degenerate rods and cones with short outer segments in the far periphery, prominent lipopigment granules in ganglion cells, and fewer lipofuscin granules in the RPE.
Analysis indicated one CLN3 allele contained a 1 kb deletion; the other allele had a single base pair deletion in exon 6 resulting in a frame shift.
The retina showed a circumferential ring of bone spicule pigment and a pale, waxy optic disc.
Autoï¬‚uorescent granules were present in the JNCL retina, with reduced numbers of lipofuscin granules in the RPE.
